What is sorting?: Sorting is the process of arranging data in ascending or descending order.
Why is sorting important?: It helps organize data and makes searching and analysis easier.
Bubble Sort, Selection Sort, Insertion Sort, Merge Sort, Quick Sort.
What is the difference between internal: Internal sorting happens in main memory, while external sorting is done using external storage like files.
It compares adjacent elements and swaps them if they are in the wrong order until the list is sorted.
It repeatedly finds the smallest element and places it at the beginning of the unsorted portion.
Difference between Bubble Sort and Selec: Bubble Sort swaps adjacent elements; Selection Sort finds the minimum element each pass.
It builds a sorted list one element at a time by inserting each element into its correct position.
It works efficiently for small or nearly sorted datasets.
It divides the array into halves, recursively sorts them, and merges them together.
O(n log n) in all cases.
Efficient for large datasets and is stable.
Requires extra space for merging (O(n) space).
It selects a pivot, partitions elements around it, and recursively sorts the sublists.
Best/Average: O(n log n), Worst: O(n²).
Which is faster, Merge Sort or Quick Sor: Quick Sort is usually faster due to better cache performance.
Which sorting algorithms are stable?: Bubble Sort, Insertion Sort, and Merge Sort.
What is a stable sort?: A stable sort keeps the relative order of elements with equal values.
Can strings be sorted?: Yes, because strings can be compared lexicographically.
Difference between in-place and out-of-p: In-place uses constant memory; out-of-place uses extra space.
What sorting algorithm does Python use?: Python uses Timsort, a hybrid of Merge and Insertion Sort (O(n log n)).
What is Object-Oriented Programming (OOP: OOP organizes code using objects and classes that model real-world entities.
What is a class?: A class is a blueprint for creating objects.
What is an object?: An object is an instance of a class containing data and behavior.
Class is a design; object is its implementation.
What is __init__ method?: It is a constructor used to initialize object attributes.
What is self in Python classes?: It refers to the current object of the class.
What is encapsulation?: It means hiding data and allowing controlled access through methods.
What is inheritance?: It allows one class to use properties and methods of another class.
What is polymorphism?: It allows methods with the same name to behave differently in different classes.
What is method overriding?: When a child class defines a method with the same name as its parent’s method.
What is abstraction?: It hides complex implementation details and shows only essential features.
What is a constructor in Python?: A special method (__init__) that initializes data when an object is created.
What is a destructor in Python?: A special method (__del__) called when an object is deleted.
What are instance and class variables?: Instance variables belong to each object; class variables are shared across all objects.
What is multiple inheritance?: When a class inherits from more than one parent class.
What is hierarchical inheritance?: When multiple child classes inherit from one parent class.
What is hybrid inheritance?: A combination of two or more types of inheritance.
What is data hiding?: Making variables private using double underscores (__).
Difference between overloading and overr: Overloading changes parameters (not directly supported in Python); overriding redefines parent methods.
Used to call a parent class constructor or method from a child class.
What are getters and setters?: Methods to access (get) or modify (set) private data members.
What is __str__ method?: It defines how an object should be represented as a string.
Can Python have multiple constructors?: No, but we can simulate them using default arguments.
Procedural focuses on functions; OOP focuses on objects and classes.
Why use OOP?: It improves code reusability, modularity, and readability.
What is an abstract class?: A class that cannot be instantiated and provides a base for other classes.
A Car class with attributes like color and methods like start() and stop().
What is composition?: When a class contains objects of another class as members.
Difference between @staticmethod and @cl: @staticmethod doesn’t use class or instance; @classmethod uses class reference.
How can we use OOP in sorting?: By creating a Sorting class with methods for different sorting algorithms.
Can sorting algorithms be polymorphic?: Yes, each sorting algorithm can override a common sort() method.
Give an example where OOP and sorting wo: Sorting a list of Student objects based on marks using Bubble Sort in a class method.
Why is encapsulation useful in sorting p: It hides the sorting logic and makes the code reusable and organized.
What are real-life uses of sorting algor: Used in ranking systems, search engines, and organizing large datasets.
